results.title: Afro-Carib Fest
results.content:
What to Expect:  
Live Performances – Enjoy electrifying shows from 120+ local & international artists  
Vendor Marketplace – Shop unique cultural treasures,  gifts, arts and crafts, from local businesses  
Food Zone – Indulge in mouth-watering African & Caribbean delicacies  
Dance Competitions – Show off your dance moves & win cash prizes  
Drum & Dance Workshops – Learn from the best and engage with our local artists  
DJ Sound Clash – Non-stop beats from our top DJs [...] FEO
FEO
FEO
FEO
FEO
FEO

# Afro-Carib Fest

slide-0
slide-1
slide-2
slide-3

#### More Information

### Event Description

Experience the Ultimate Celebration of African & Caribbean Culture!

Join us for the 14th annual  Afro-Carib Fest 2025, an award-winning, FREE weekend festival that celebrates the vibrant Afro-Caribbean culture through live music, dance, food, and art!

Date: August 23rd & 24th, 2025  
Time: 12 PM – 9 PM  
Location: Thomson Memorial Park, Scarborough

results.title: Riverbank State Park
results.content:
Share This Listing

Twitter

Facebook

LinkedIn

Pinterest [...] in the last decades. [...] Riverbank’s 28.5 acres, hosting almost four million visitors a year, offers dozens of activities and commanding views of the Hudson, all atop the North River Water Treatment Plant, which cleans up after a million New Yorkers. The park turns a necessary eyesore into a community asset. But this clever compromise was hard to come by and remains tenuous, as concerns over the health effects of the plant’s operations persist.

results.answer: The Hamilton Heights Caribbean Festival will feature live music and dance at Riverbank State Park in New York City in 2025. The event is free and celebrates Harlem history and culture. The exact date is September 20, 2025.
